io.elegie.luchess.web.framework.routing

Class ControllerUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elegie.luchess.web.framework.routing.ControllerUtil

  • public final class ControllerUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides utility methods to work with controllers. These methods may be relocated elsewhere, once we get enough feedback about the use of the framework.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.reflect.Method findControllerMethod(java.lang.Class<?> controller)
      Given an object, find the controller method (inspecting all of its public methods), or return null if no such method is found.
      static java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> findControllersByPackage(java.lang.String scannedPackage)
      Discovers all controllers from a given package, searching recursively.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • findControllersByPackage

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> findControllersByPackage(java.lang.String scannedPackage)
        Discovers all controllers from a given package, searching recursively.
        Parameters:
        scannedPackage - The root package to be searched.
        Returns:
        A list of all controllers contained within the package (or its children).

      • findControllerMethod

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findControllerMethod(java.lang.Class<?> controller)
                                                     throws ControllerException
        Given an object, find the controller method (inspecting all of its public methods), or return null if no such method is found.
        Parameters:
        controller - The class of the object to assert as a controller.
        Returns:
        The controller method, or null if no such method.
        Throws:
        ControllerException - When a controller method has been specified on the class, but appears to be malformed.
